div.p: Oh that’s quite an easy question, yeah, because my hours are 9 at night until 6 in the morning; I get worn out because of work
basically but I do enjoy work but it wears me out physically and mentally. With cerebral palsy people don’t understand, normal people like yourself
it’s, you know, you walk around and it just becomes natural, with my disability which most people don’t understand you’re constantly using your brain
I walk from the door to my chair I think what’s going to be in the way? Is somebody going to come out and break my concentration?
One foot in front of the other is a constant, your brain is always working because it’s the balance, it’s the coordination; with my disability
it’s the movement of the hands, it’s the legs, I have no sensation in my hands so that’s a challenge, picking up a hot cup of coffee
I can’t feel the heat but lifting it up I have to think about that because the water could spill out so yeah everything’s a challenge.
